ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to better analyze texts and films, it helped a lot!
I learned a lot of about underlying themes of Greek films and literature and how they may reflect parts of the Greek culture throughout history
A greater understanding of my writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoy the small seminar, it allowed for a lot of different interactions with my classmates and professors. Not really any weaknesses I think of on the top of my head.

This course pushes you out of your comfort zone which was good. The class is small which facilitated good class discussion. Student presentations in class were a good part of the class requirements. Office hours were helpful so that papers could be reviewed

Strengths: very engaging and interesting content, albeit "weird", but I liked the change of pace
Weaknesses: sometimes it was too much reading for one week and I didn't have enough time to thoroughly read/reread if I didn't completely understand the first time around

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I'm a bio major and I felt that my writing and analysis skills improved greatly!
Yes English is not my area of focus or main area of interest and I really enjoyed this class.

Yes, but if you're a student who stresses over grades, I wouldn't. Prof. Syrimis is amazing, engaging, and kind, but he does take a long time with grading, so if that's something that stresses you out, I wouldn't recommend. He gives thorough feedback though, and he will meet with you if you ask him to.

extras.title: FILM 243 01/MGRK 218 01/WGSS 245 01 - Family in Greek Lit & Film TR
